title: Bug 6410: File unchanged but dirtied by code assist
description: There is a bug where code assist is dirtying the file even though no changes are made to it. This happens when code assist has nothing to suggest.
OB: When using code assist in a Java file by pressing CtrlSpace with the cursor placed inside the leftmost parenthesis of a method call, the file gets dirtied even though no changes are made.
EB: If code assist has nothing to suggest, it should not dirty the file.
SR:
To reproduce the issue: 
1. Open a Java file. 
2. Place the cursor inside the leftmost parenthesis of a method call. For example, consider "I" to be the cursor below:
   Object o = anotherObject.method(I);
3. Press CtrlSpace to invoke code assist.
